Message: Hi, I’m the NewsBreak Ad Assistant. How can I help?
The user completes the submission of the form
What’s the allowed time window between the ad click and the postback for the conversion to be accepted?

The allowed time window between the ad click and the postback for a conversion to be accepted is not explicitly mentioned in the available documentation. If you have specific requirements or need further clarification, I recommend reaching out to our support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com for detailed information.

I’m running a campaign using a landing page and RedTrack as my tracker. I’ve set up the API integration and confirmed that clicks, landing page visits, and conversions are tracking correctly in RedTrack.

RedTrack is firing the postbacks to NewsBreak, but the conversions are not showing in my NewsBreak dashboard.

It sounds like you've set up everything correctly on the RedTrack side, but the conversions aren't appearing in your NewsBreak dashboard. Here are a few things you can check:

1. **Verify Postback URL**: Ensure that the postback URL is correctly configured in RedTrack. It should match the format provided by NewsBreak.

2. **Check Event Type**: Make sure that the event type in your postback URL is correctly specified and matches what you've set up in NewsBreak.

3. **Test Conversion Flow**: Use the test feature to ensure that conversions are being tracked end-to-end.

4. **Click ID and Timestamp**: If RedTrack is recording conversions but they aren't showing on NewsBreak, gather the click ID and timestamp for those conversions and contact adsupport@newsbreak.com for further assistance.

For more detailed steps, you can refer to this [RedTrack Postback Setup Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/25515090832013-How-to-set-up-a-RedTrack-Postback-on-NewsBreak).

What is the exact maximum allowed time window between the ad click and the postback for a conversion to be accepted?
I am sending conversions approximately 60-70 minutes after the click, and they are not showing in the dashboard. Are these conversions rejected due to click ID expiration?

The exact maximum allowed time window between the ad click and the postback for a conversion to be accepted isn't specified in the available documentation. However, if conversions are not showing in the NewsBreak dashboard, it could be due to click ID expiration or other factors. I recommend checking with your tracking platform to ensure that the click ID is still valid when sending postbacks. If you continue to experience issues, please email adsupport@newsbreak.com with details about your setup and any relevant timestamps for further assistance.
how to get $500 credit for converting clickbank offers?

To receive $500 in ad credits for converting ClickBank offers, you need to be a Silver or Gold affiliate. Additionally, an onboarding call with our Account Managers and business verification are required. You can schedule the call through this link: [NewsBreak Advertising Consultation](https://calendly.com/d/z4w-3t3-rkw/newsbreak-advertising-consultation).

I created a new event with postback url and after testing it was successful. But once I try to save it I keep getting this error and i can understand why; Invalid operation. "Please reach out to your Account Manager for more information if it persists. Thank you!"

It sounds like you're encountering an issue with saving your event after a successful test. Since the error message suggests reaching out to your Account Manager, it might be related to account permissions or settings. If you don't have an Account Manager, I recommend contacting our support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com for further assistance. They should be able to help resolve this issue for you.
i cant see my conversions in newsbreak dashboard but I do see it in my tracker, Redtrack and clickbank dashboard. How come I cant see it on Newsbreak?

If your conversions are showing up in RedTrack and ClickBank but not on the NewsBreak dashboard, it might be due to an issue with the postback setup or data transmission. Here are a few things you can check:

1. **Postback URL Configuration**: Ensure that the postback URL is correctly configured in RedTrack to send conversion data to NewsBreak.
2. **Click ID Passing**: Make sure that the Click ID is being passed correctly through all redirects to ensure accurate tracking.
3. **Event Setup**: Verify that your event is set up correctly in NewsBreak's Event Management. You can use the ‘Go Test’ feature to check if conversion events are being received.

For more detailed guidance, you can refer to our article on setting up a ClickBank Postback on NewsBreak [here](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/23746617571341-How-to-set-up-a-ClickBank-Postback-on-NewsBreak). If everything seems correct and you're still facing issues, please reach out to adsupport@newsbreak.com for further assistance.
i have tested the event setup (Complete_payment) and it was successful.

Great to hear that the event setup for 'Complete_payment' was successful! Since the test was successful but you're still not seeing conversions in the NewsBreak dashboard, it might be a delay in data syncing or an issue with how the data is being displayed. Here are a few steps you can take:

1. **Check Data Sync**: Sometimes there can be a delay in data syncing between platforms. Give it some time and check back later.
2. **Dashboard Filters**: Ensure that there are no filters applied on your NewsBreak dashboard that might be hiding the conversion data.
3. **Re-verify Postback URL**: Double-check that the postback URL is correctly set up and matches what is required by NewsBreak.

If you've checked these and still face issues, please contact adsupport@newsbreak.com for further assistance.
